item.title: 利差交易平仓，风险情绪受挫，日元上涨
item.description: 周四，在日本央行（BOJ）下周政策会议召开之前，套利交易平仓为日元提供了支撑，同时，大盘成长股的轮动也广泛抑制了风险偏好，并提供了一些避险买盘。【原文：The yen drew support from unwinding carry trades on Thursday ahead of next week's Bank of Japan (BOJ) policy meeting and as a rotation out of megacap growth stocks dampened risk appetite broadly and provided some safe haven bids.】

item.title: 电池公司 LG Energy Solution 第二季度利润因电动汽车需求疲软而大幅下滑
item.description: 韩国电池公司 LG Energy Solution（LGES）周四公布，受电池驱动的电动汽车（EV）需求减弱的影响，该公司季度利润下降了 58%。【原文：South Korean battery firm LG Energy Solution (LGES) posted on Thursday a 58% drop in quarterly profit, hit by weakening demand for battery-powered electric vehicles (EVs).】

item.title: 据《纽约时报》报道，默多克与子女就继承权问题打官司
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周三报道，传媒大亨鲁珀特-默多克（Rupert Murdoch）正在与他的三个子女打官司，以确保他的长子、也是他选定的接班人拉克兰-默多克（Lachlan Murdoch）将继续掌管他的传媒帝国。【原文：Media mogul Rupert Murdoch is engaged in a legal battle against three of his children to ensure that his eldest son and chosen successor, Lachlan Murdoch, will remain in charge of his media empire, the New York Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 澳新银行对债券交易指控的初步分析没有发现操纵市场的证据
item.description: 澳大利亚澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）周四表示，该集团对围绕 2023 年 10 年期国债发行执行情况的调查进行了初步分析，未发现任何操纵市场的证据。【原文：Australia's ANZ Group said on Thursday its own preliminary analysis of the investigation around the execution of a 2023 issuance of 10-year treasury bonds has not found any evidence of market manipulation.】

item.title: 英伟达供应商 SK 海力士第二季度利润因人工智能热潮而飙升
item.description: 韩国 SK 海力士（SK Hynix）周四公布了 2018 年以来最高的季度利润，原因是这家英伟达（Nvidia）供应商的先进 DRAM 芯片（如用于生成式人工智能芯片组的高带宽内存（HBM））销售火爆。【原文：South Korea's SK Hynix posted on Thursday its highest quarterly profit since 2018 as the Nvidia supplier sees explosive sales of its advanced DRAM chips such as high bandwidth memory (HBM) used in generative AI chipsets.】

item.title: 消息人士称，G20 将支持累进税制，但不支持 "亿万富豪税
item.description: 两名 20 国集团（G20）官员告诉路透社，在巴西举行会议的 20 国集团（G20）财政领导人正准备在周四发表一份联合声明，支持累进税制，但不会赞同东道主提出的全球 "亿万富翁税 "建议。【原文：G20 finance leaders meeting in Brazil are preparing a joint statement for Thursday in support of progressive taxation that will stop short of endorsing the hosts' proposal for a global "billionaire tax," two G20 officials told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国敲定波音737 MAX认罪协议细节
item.description: 美国司法部周三向法院提交的一份文件显示，波音公司已同意承认一项共谋诈骗的刑事指控，并支付 2.436 亿美元的罚款，因为这家飞机制造商违反了 2021 年的延期起诉协议。【原文：The Justice Department said Boeing had agreed to plead guilty to a criminal fraud conspiracy charge and pay a fine of $243.6 million after the planemaker breached a 2021 deferred prosecution agreement, according to a court filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道物流巨头 Lineage 在 2024 年最大 IPO 中融资 44.5 亿美元
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士周三表示，全球最大的冷藏仓库运营商 Lineage 在美国首次公开募股中募集了 44.5 亿美元，成为今年全球首次公开募股募集资金最多的公司。【原文：Lineage , the world's largest operator of cold-storage warehouses, raised $4.45 billion in its U.S. initial public offering, setting it up for the biggest stock market debut globally this year, two people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 墨西哥面包制造商宾博第二季度利润下降 16
item.description: 墨西哥面包制造商宾博公司（Bimbo）周三发布报告称，该公司第二季度净利润为 33.2 亿比索（1.8156 亿美元），与去年同期相比下滑了 16.3%。【原文：Mexican breadmaker Bimbo's second-quarter net profit slipped by 16.3% compared to the same period last year to 3.32 billion pesos ($181.56 million), the firm reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 亚洲 一场巨型海啸正向您袭来
item.description: Alden Bentley 纽约亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets by Alden Bentley in New York】

item.title: 消息人士称，德事隆接近收购 Spirit Aero 公司的 V-280 军用飞机机身项目
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，德事隆公司即将从 Spirit AeroSystems 公司收购其 V-280 军用飞机的机身制造项目，这是波音公司最近收购这家总部位于堪萨斯州的供应商的最新交易。【原文：Textron is close to acquiring the fuselage-making program for its V-280 military aircraft from Spirit AeroSystems , according to a source familiar with the matter, in the latest carve-out from Boeing's recent deal to acquire the Kansas-based supplier.】

item.title: Ameriprise Financial 因手续费收入强劲而利润大增
item.description: 本周三，Ameriprise Financial 公布第二季度调整后利润大增 9%，原因是客户资产价值的上升提高了这家财务顾问公司的收费收入。【原文：Ameriprise Financial posted a 9% jump in second-quarter adjusted profit on Wednesday as rising client asset values boosted the financial adviser's fee-based income.】

item.title: 受设备需求影响，联合租赁第二季度利润增长
item.description: 设备租赁公司 United Rentals 周三公布，受工业工具需求强劲和租金上涨的支撑，第二季度利润增长 7.6%。【原文：Equipment rental firm United Rentals posted a 7.6% rise in second-quarter profit on Wednesday, backed by robust demand for industrial tools and higher rental rates.】

item.title: 中国对跨国公司台湾员工说：不要违法，也不用害怕
item.description: 中国政府周三表示，在中国的跨国公司工作的台湾员工只要不触犯法律就不用害怕，因为新的法律规定在极端情况下对 "顽固的 "分裂分子执行死刑。【原文：Taiwan staff at multinational firms in China have nothing to fear as long as they don't break the law, the Chinese government said on Wednesday, following new legal guidelines that mandate execution in extreme cases for "diehard" separatists.】

item.title: 墨西哥沃尔玛第二季度净利润增长 9
item.description: 沃尔玛墨西哥和中美洲分部周三公布，其第二季度净利润同比增长 9.3%，达到 125.1 亿比索。【原文：Walmart's Mexico and Central America unit posted a 9.3% year-on-year climb in its second-quarter net profit on Wednesday, reaching 12.51 billion pesos.】

item.title: 美股抛售，"恐惧指数 "创三个月新高
item.description: 美国股市的大幅抛售使华尔街最关注的市场波动率指标创下三个月来的新高，并推动了周三的期权交易量，尽管策略师们几乎看不到恐慌的迹象。【原文：A hefty U.S. stocks sell-off sent Wall Street's most watched gauge of market volatility to a three-month high and boosted options trading volume on Wednesday, though strategists saw little evidence of panic.】

item.title: NBA 与迪士尼、亚马逊和康卡斯特签署转播协议
item.description: 沃尔特-迪斯尼（Walt Disney）旗下的 ESPN、康卡斯特（Comcast）旗下的 NBC 环球（NBCUniversal）和亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）达成了一项据说价值 760 亿美元的交易，获得了美国国家篮球协会（National Basketball Association）比赛的转播权。【原文：Walt Disney's ESPN, Comcast-owned NBCUniversal and Amazon.com have clinched the rights to carry National Basketball Association games in a reported $76 billion deal.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称汽车制造商本田将削减在中国的汽油车产能
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周四报道，由于日本汽车在中国的销量下降，本田汽车计划将其在中国的汽油燃料汽车产量减少三分之一。【原文：Honda Motor plans to reduce the production of its gasoline-fueled automobiles in China by one-third, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Thursday, amid declining sales of Japanese cars in the Asian country.】

item.title: 卷饼需求强劲，Chipotle 季度销售额超出预期
item.description: 本周三，Chipotle Mexican Grill 公司的季度销售额超过了市场预期，这得益于市场对其米饭碗和卷饼的持续需求，即使菜单上的产品价格越来越高。【原文：Chipotle Mexican Grill surpassed market estimates for quarterly sales on Wednesday, benefiting from consistent demand for its rice bowls and burritos even as menu items get pricier.】

item.title: IBM季度营收超预期，得益于软件实力和人工智能需求
item.description: IBM周三公布的第二季度营收超出分析师预期，这主要得益于客户对其软件的强劲需求，以及希望利用这一蓬勃发展的技术的客户增加了与人工智能相关的支出，从而使其股价在盘后交易中上涨了5%。【原文：IBM beat analysts' estimates for second-quarter revenue on Wednesday, riding on strong demand for its software and higher AI-linked spending by clients looking to tap the booming technology, sending its shares up 5% in extended trading.】

item.title: 纽蒙特黄金产量增加，利润超出预期
item.description: 纽蒙特公司（Newmont Corp）周三公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期，这家全球最大的黄金矿商受益于强劲的生产和成本下降。【原文：Newmont Corp beat Wall Street expectations for second-quarter profit on Wednesday, as the world's biggest gold miner benefited from robust production and easing costs.】

item.title: 福特第二季度调整后利润下降，电动汽车业务受挫
item.description: 福特汽车公司周三报告称，该公司第二季度调整后利润下降，原因是电动汽车业务盈利能力下降。【原文：Ford Motor reported a dip in its second-quarter adjusted profit on Wednesday, as the automaker battles lower profitability in its electric vehicle business.】

item.title: 消息人士称，没有迹象表明微软计划限制 Crowdstrike 对 Windows 的访问权限
item.description: 在该网络安全软件产品引发的全球技术故障导致许多运行 Windows 的计算机崩溃后，一位熟悉此事的人士说，没有迹象表明微软公司计划限制 Crowdstrike 对 Windows 操作系统的访问。【原文：There is no sign Microsoft Corp plans to limit Crowdstrike's access to the Windows operating system, a person familiar with the issue said, after a global tech outage caused by the cybersecurity software product caused many computers running Windows to crash.】

item.title: 报告称美国 7 月轻型汽车新车销量将增长约 1
item.description: 汽车数据提供商S&P Global Mobility周三表示，在上个月经销商软件出现重要故障可能导致销售推迟到7月份之后，美国新轻型汽车销量预计将同比增长约1%。【原文：U.S. new light vehicle sales are expected to rise about 1% from a year earlier, after a crucial dealer software outage last month likely deferred sales to July, automotive data provider S&P Global Mobility said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国现货以太坊 ETF 首日净流入 1.06 亿美元
item.description: 根据 CF Benchmarks 和几家交易公司提供的数据，周二，与全球第二大加密货币以太币现货价格挂钩的九只交易所交易基金（ETF）在美国证券交易所开始交易，吸引了 1.06 亿美元的资金净流入。【原文：The nine exchange-traded funds (ETFs) tied to the spot price of ether, the world's second-largest cryptocurrency, scooped up net inflows of $106 million on Tuesday as they began trading on U.S. stock exchanges, according to data from CF Benchmarks and several trading firms.】

item.title: 美国民主党人发起法案，要求石油公司对与欧佩克的任何合作负责
item.description: 美国民主党立法者周三提出一项法案，如果联邦监管机构发现能源公司与石油输出国组织串通抬高油价，将追究这些公司的责任。【原文：Democratic U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday introduced a bill to hold energy companies accountable if they are found by federal regulators to have colluded with the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries to raise oil prices.】

item.title: 空置办公室加剧压力，Blackstone 备受打击的抵押贷款基金下滑
item.description: 商业地产融资公司 Blackstone Mortgage Trust 周三股价下跌 10%，原因是该公司在办公空间空置率持续紧张的情况下将股息削减了 24%。【原文：Commercial real estate finance company Blackstone Mortgage Trust saw shares drop 10% on Wednesday as the firm cut its dividend 24% in the face of continued strain from vacancy-ravaged office spaces.】

item.title: Shein 将在南非开设快闪店以吸引更多购物者
item.description: 以 5 美元上衣和 10 美元连衣裙闻名的快时尚巨头 Shein 将于 8 月在南非约翰内斯堡开设一家临时商店，这家在线零售商旨在扩大其品牌在南非的知名度。【原文：Fast-fashion giant Shein, known for its $5 tops and $10 dresses, will open a pop-up store in Johannesburg, South Africa in August as the online retailer aims to expand its brand recognition in the country.】

item.title: 雷诺坚持 2024 年展望，上半年利润超预期
item.description: 本周三，雷诺公布的上半年营业利润好于预期，这主要得益于强劲的定价和新车投放，雷诺还坚持了全年利润率预测。【原文：Renault posted a better-than-expected operating profit for the first half of the year on Wednesday due to strong pricing and new vehicle launches, and stuck to its full-year profit-margin forecast.】

item.title: 环球音乐第二季度收入超出预期
item.description: 环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）是泰勒-斯威夫特（Taylor Swift）、BTS 和德雷克（Drake）的唱片公司。【原文：Universal Music Group , the label representing Taylor Swift, BTS and Drake, on Wednesday recorded higher than expected second quarter sales, driven by growth across all segments.】
